en.summary: Calculate your net income after all taxes and deductions from gross annual income.
en.description: Comprehensive net income calculator that determines your take-home pay after federal income tax, state income tax, Social Security, Medicare, and other deductions. Perfect for salary planning, tax estimation, and understanding your true earning power.
instructions: Enter your gross annual income
Select your filing status (single, married, etc.)
Enter number of dependents
Choose your state for accurate state tax calculations
Select tax year for current tax brackets
View your detailed tax breakdown and net income
en.formula:
Taxable Income = Gross Income - Standard Deduction - (Dependents × Dependent Exemption)
Federal Tax = Calculate using tax brackets for filing status
FICA Tax = (Social Security 6.2% + Medicare 1.45%) × Gross Income
State Tax = State-specific tax calculation
Net Income = Gross Income - Federal Tax - State Tax - FICA Tax

seoContent.introduction: Calculate your net income and take-home pay with our comprehensive Net Income Calculator. Understanding your true earnings after taxes is crucial for financial planning, salary negotiations, and retirement planning. Our calculator provides detailed breakdowns of federal, state, and payroll taxes to give you a complete picture of your after-tax income.
benefits: Calculate accurate net income from gross annual salary
Understand your complete tax burden including federal, state, and FICA taxes
Compare different filing statuses and states
Plan your finances with realistic take-home pay estimates
Make informed decisions about salary offers and tax planning
See the impact of dependents and deductions on your taxes
howToUse: Enter your gross annual income before any deductions
Select your tax filing status (single, married filing jointly, etc.)
Enter the number of dependents you claim
Choose your state of residence for accurate state tax calculations
Select the tax year to use current tax brackets and rates
Review your complete tax breakdown and net income results
seoContent.formulaExplanation: Net income calculation follows standard US tax procedures: First, calculate taxable income by subtracting standard deductions and dependent exemptions from gross income. Then apply federal tax brackets based on filing status, calculate FICA taxes (Social Security at 6.2% + Medicare at 1.45%), and apply state-specific tax rates. The final net income is gross income minus all taxes and deductions.
examples: A single filer in California earning $75,000 annually would pay approximately $10,250 in federal tax, $4,875 in state tax, and $5,550 in FICA taxes, leaving $54,825 in net income

A married couple filing jointly in Texas with $120,000 income and 2 dependents would pay $16,200 in federal tax, $0 in state tax (Texas has no state income tax), and $8,880 in FICA taxes, resulting in $89,700 net income
seoContent.whoShouldUse: Employees evaluating salary offers, freelancers calculating their true earnings, small business owners understanding employee compensation costs, tax professionals, financial advisors, and anyone wanting to understand their complete tax situation and take-home pay.
seoContent.importantNotes: This calculator provides estimates based on 2024 tax brackets and standard deductions. Actual taxes may vary based on additional income, deductions, credits, and local tax laws. Consult a tax professional for personalized tax advice. FICA taxes have income caps for Social Security ($168,600 in 2024).
relatedTools: Paycheck Calculator - Calculate take-home pay from a single paycheck
Tax Calculator - Estimate detailed tax liability and brackets
Salary Calculator - Calculate total compensation packages
Hourly to Salary Calculator - Convert hourly wages to annual salary

faqs.question: What's the difference between gross income and net income?
faqs.answer: Gross income is your total earnings before any taxes or deductions are taken out. Net income (take-home pay) is what you actually receive after federal income tax, state income tax, Social Security, Medicare, and other deductions are subtracted.

faqs.question: What is taxable income?
faqs.answer: Taxable income is your gross income minus deductions and exemptions. For most people, this includes the standard deduction ($14,600 for single filers in 2024) and dependent exemptions. Only the taxable income amount is subject to federal and state income taxes.

faqs.question: What are FICA taxes?
faqs.answer: FICA (Federal Insurance Contributions Act) taxes include Social Security tax (6.2%) and Medicare tax (1.45%), for a total of 7.65%. These are payroll taxes that fund Social Security retirement benefits and Medicare healthcare. Social Security tax applies only up to an income cap ($168,600 in 2024).

faqs.question: How do dependents affect my taxes?
faqs.answer: Dependents can reduce your taxable income through exemptions or credits. In 2024, each dependent exemption reduces your taxable income by $4,700. The Child Tax Credit provides up to $2,000 per qualifying child, and there are additional credits for education and other dependents.

faqs.question: Why do states have different tax rates?
faqs.answer: Eight states have no state income tax (Texas, Florida, Nevada, Washington, Wyoming, South Dakota, Alaska, Tennessee). Other states have progressive tax systems with rates ranging from about 3% to 13.3%, depending on income level and state-specific tax structures.

steps: Enter your values in the input fields provided
Review the automatic calculations and results
Adjust inputs to explore different scenarios
Use the results for your planning and decision-making
Save or share your calculations as needed
Consult professionals for personalized advice

es.title: Calculadora de Ingreso Neto
es.seoTitle: Calculadora de Ingreso Neto - ¿Cuál Es Mi Ingreso Neto?
es.metaDescription: Calcula tu ingreso neto y salario después de impuestos federales, estatales y FICA. Calculadora gratuita de ingresos anuales para planificación fiscal y análisis salarial.
longTailKeywords: cómo calcular ingreso neto desde ingreso bruto
cuál es mi ingreso neto después de impuestos
calculadora ingreso neto con impuestos federales y estatales
calcular salario después impuestos desde salario anual
calculadora impuesto ingreso anual
cuántos impuestos pago en mi ingreso
ingreso neto después de impuestos federales estatales y seguridad social
calculadora tasa efectiva impuestos
cómo calcular ingreso gravable
conversión ingreso bruto a neto
es.summary: Calcula tu ingreso neto después de todos los impuestos y deducciones desde ingreso bruto anual.
es.description: Calculadora completa de ingreso neto que determina tu salario después de impuesto federal a la renta, impuesto estatal a la renta, Seguro Social, Medicare y otras deducciones. Perfecta para planificación salarial, estimación de impuestos y entender tu verdadero poder adquisitivo.
instructions: Ingresa tu ingreso bruto anual
Selecciona tu estado civil (soltero, casado, etc.)
Ingresa número de dependientes
Elige tu estado para cálculos precisos de impuesto estatal
Selecciona año fiscal para categorías de impuestos actuales
Ve tu desglose detallado de impuestos e ingreso neto
es.formula:
Ingreso Gravable = Ingreso Bruto - Deducción Estándar - (Dependientes × Exención Dependiente)
Impuesto Federal = Calcular usando categorías de impuestos para estado civil
Impuesto FICA = (Seguro Social 6.2% + Medicare 1.45%) × Ingreso Bruto
Impuesto Estatal = Cálculo específico del estado
Ingreso Neto = Ingreso Bruto - Impuesto Federal - Impuesto Estatal - Impuesto FICA

seoContent.introduction: Calculate your net income and take-home pay with our comprehensive Net Income Calculator. Understanding your true earnings after taxes is crucial for financial planning, salary negotiations, and retirement planning. Our calculator provides detailed breakdowns of federal, state, and payroll taxes to give you a complete picture of your after-tax income.
benefits: Calculate accurate net income from gross annual salary
Understand your complete tax burden including federal, state, and FICA taxes
Compare different filing statuses and states
Plan your finances with realistic take-home pay estimates
Make informed decisions about salary offers and tax planning
See the impact of dependents and deductions on your taxes
howToUse: Ingresa tu ingreso bruto anual antes de cualquier deducción
Selecciona tu estado civil (soltero, casado declarando conjuntamente, etc.)
Ingresa el número de dependientes que reclamas
Elige tu estado de residencia para cálculos precisos de impuesto estatal
Selecciona el año fiscal para usar categorías y tasas de impuestos actuales
Revisa tu desglose completo de impuestos y resultados de ingreso neto
seoContent.formulaExplanation: El cálculo de ingreso neto sigue procedimientos fiscales estándar de EE.UU.: Primero, calcula ingreso gravable restando deducciones estándar y exenciones dependientes del ingreso bruto. Luego aplica categorías de impuesto federal basado en estado civil, calcula impuestos FICA (Seguro Social al 6.2% + Medicare al 1.45%), y aplica tasas específicas del estado. El ingreso neto final es ingreso bruto menos todos los impuestos y deducciones.
examples: Un soltero en California ganando $75,000 anualmente pagaría aproximadamente $10,250 en impuesto federal, $4,875 en impuesto estatal, y $5,550 en impuestos FICA, dejando $54,825 en ingreso neto

Una pareja casada declarando conjuntamente en Texas con ingreso de $120,000 y 2 dependientes pagaría $16,200 en impuesto federal, $0 en impuesto estatal (Texas no tiene impuesto estatal a la renta), y $8,880 en impuestos FICA, resultando en $89,700 de ingreso neto
seoContent.whoShouldUse: Empleados evaluando ofertas salariales, freelancers calculando sus verdaderas ganancias, dueños de pequeños negocios entendiendo costos de compensación de empleados, profesionales fiscales, asesores financieros, y cualquiera queriendo entender su situación fiscal completa y salario después de impuestos.
seoContent.importantNotes: Esta calculadora proporciona estimaciones basadas en categorías de impuestos de 2024 y deducciones estándar. Los impuestos reales pueden variar basado en ingreso adicional, deducciones, créditos, y leyes fiscales locales. Consulta un profesional fiscal para consejo fiscal personalizado. Los impuestos FICA tienen límites de ingreso para Seguro Social ($168,600 en 2024).
relatedTools: Calculadora de Nómina - Calcula salario después de impuestos de un solo pago
Calculadora de Impuestos - Estima responsabilidad fiscal detallada y categorías
Calculadora de Salario - Calcula paquetes de compensación total
Calculadora de Horas a Salario - Convierte salarios por hora a anual

instructions: Digite sua renda bruta anual
Selecione seu estado civil (solteiro, casado, etc.)

pt.formula:
Renda Tributável = Renda Bruta - Dedução Padrão - (Dependentes × Isenção Dependente)
Imposto Federal = Calcular usando faixas de impostos para estado civil
Imposto FICA = (Previdência Social 6.2% + Medicare 1.45%) × Renda Bruta
Imposto Estadual = Cálculo específico do estado
Renda Líquida = Renda Bruta - Impuesto Federal - Impuesto Estadual - Impuesto FICA

seoContent.introduction: Calculate your net income and take-home pay with our comprehensive Net Income Calculator. Understanding your true earnings after taxes is crucial for financial planning, salary negotiations, and retirement planning. Our calculator provides detailed breakdowns of federal, state, and payroll taxes to give you a complete picture of your after-tax income.
benefits: Calculate accurate net income from gross annual salary
Understand your complete tax burden including federal, state, and FICA taxes
Compare different filing statuses and states
Plan your finances with realistic take-home pay estimates
Make informed decisions about salary offers and tax planning
See the impact of dependents and deductions on your taxes
howToUse: Digite sua renda bruta anual antes de qualquer dedução
Selecione seu estado civil (solteiro, casado declarando em conjunto, etc.)
Digite o número de dependentes que você reclama
Escolha seu estado de residência para cálculos precisos de imposto estadual
Selecione o ano fiscal para usar faixas e taxas de impostos atuais
Revise sua quebra completa de impostos e resultados de renda líquida
seoContent.formulaExplanation: Cálculo de renda líquida segue procedimentos fiscais padrão dos EUA: Primeiro, calcula renda tributável subtraindo deduções padrão e isenções dependentes da renda bruta. Então aplica faixas de imposto federal baseado em estado civil, calcula impostos FICA (Previdência Social a 6.2% + Medicare a 1.45%), e aplica taxas específicas do estado. A renda líquida final é renda bruta menos todos os impostos e deduções.
examples: Um solteiro na Califórnia ganhando R$75.000 anualmente pagaria aproximadamente R$10.250 em imposto federal, R$4.875 em imposto estadual, e R$5.550 em impostos FICA, deixando R$54.825 em renda líquida

Um casal casado declarando em conjunto no Texas com renda de R$120.000 e 2 dependentes pagaria R$16.200 em imposto federal, R$0 em imposto estadual (Texas não tem imposto estadual de renda), e R$8.880 em impostos FICA, resultando em R$89.700 de renda líquida
seoContent.whoShouldUse: Funcionários avaliando ofertas salariais, freelancers calculando suas verdadeiras ganhos, donos de pequenos negócios entendendo custos de compensação de funcionários, profissionais fiscais, consultores financeiros, e qualquer pessoa querendo entender sua situação fiscal completa e salário após impostos.
seoContent.importantNotes: Esta calculadora fornece estimativas baseadas em faixas de impostos de 2024 e deduções padrão. Impostos reais podem variar baseado em renda adicional, deduções, créditos, e leis fiscais locais. Consulte um profissional fiscal para conselho fiscal personalizado. Impostos FICA têm limites de renda para Previdência Social (R$168.600 em 2024).

fr.title: Calculateur de Revenu Net
fr.seoTitle: Calculateur de Revenu Net - Quel Est Mon Revenu Net?
fr.metaDescription: Calculez votre revenu net et salaire après impôts fédéraux, étatiques et FICA. Calculateur gratuit de revenus annuels pour planification fiscale et analyse salariale.
longTailKeywords: comment calculer revenu net à partir du revenu brut
quel est mon revenu net après impôts
calculateur revenu net avec impôts fédéraux et étatiques
calculer salaire après impôts à partir du salaire annuel
calculateur impôt revenu annuel
combien d'impôts je paie sur mon revenu
revenu net après impôts fédéraux étatiques et sécurité sociale
calculateur taux effectif impôts
comment calculer revenu imposable
conversion revenu brut en net
fr.summary: Calculez votre revenu net après tous les impôts et déductions du revenu brut annuel.
fr.description: Calculateur complet de revenu net qui détermine votre salaire après impôt fédéral sur le revenu, impôt étatique sur le revenu, Sécurité Sociale, Medicare et autres déductions. Parfait pour planification salariale, estimation d'impôts et comprendre votre véritable pouvoir d'achat.
instructions: Entrez votre revenu brut annuel
Sélectionnez votre statut matrimonial (célibataire, marié, etc.)
Entrez nombre de personnes à charge
Choisissez votre état pour calculs précis d'impôt étatique
Sélectionnez l'année fiscale pour utiliser les tranches d'impôt actuelles
Consultez votre ventilation détaillée d'impôts et revenu net
fr.formula:
Revenu Imposable = Revenu Brut - Déduction Standard - (Personnes à Charge × Exemption Personne à Charge)
Impôt Fédéral = Calculer en utilisant tranches d'impôt pour statut matrimonial
Impôt FICA = (Sécurité Sociale 6.2% + Medicare 1.45%) × Revenu Brut
Impôt État = Calcul spécifique de l'état
Revenu Net = Revenu Brut - Impôt Fédéral - Impôt État - Impôt FICA

seoContent.introduction: Calculate your net income and take-home pay with our comprehensive Net Income Calculator. Understanding your true earnings after taxes is crucial for financial planning, salary negotiations, and retirement planning. Our calculator provides detailed breakdowns of federal, state, and payroll taxes to give you a complete picture of your after-tax income.
benefits: Calculate accurate net income from gross annual salary
Understand your complete tax burden including federal, state, and FICA taxes
Compare different filing statuses and states
Plan your finances with realistic take-home pay estimates
Make informed decisions about salary offers and tax planning
See the impact of dependents and deductions on your taxes
howToUse: Entrez votre revenu brut annuel avant toute déduction
Sélectionnez votre statut matrimonial (célibataire, marié déclarant conjointement, etc.)
Entrez le nombre de personnes à charge que vous réclamez
Choisissez votre état de résidence pour calculs précis d'impôt étatique
Sélectionnez l'année fiscale pour utiliser tranches et taux d'impôt actuels
Consultez votre ventilation complète d'impôts et résultats de revenu net
seoContent.formulaExplanation: Calcul de revenu net suit procédures fiscales standard des États-Unis : D'abord, calculez revenu imposable en soustrayant déductions standard et exemptions personnes à charge du revenu brut. Puis appliquez tranches d'impôt fédéral basé sur statut matrimonial, calculez impôts FICA (Sécurité Sociale à 6.2% + Medicare à 1.45%), et appliquez taux spécifiques de l'état. Le revenu net final est revenu brut moins tous impôts et déductions.
examples: Un célibataire en Californie gagnant €75.000 annuellement paierait environ €10.250 en impôt fédéral, €4.875 en impôt étatique, et €5.550 en impôts FICA, laissant €54.825 en revenu net

Un couple marié déclarant conjointement au Texas avec revenu de €120.000 et 2 personnes à charge paierait €16.200 en impôt fédéral, €0 en impôt étatique (Texas n'a pas d'impôt étatique sur le revenu), et €8.880 en impôts FICA, résultant en €89.700 de revenu net
seoContent.whoShouldUse: Employés évaluant offres salariales, freelances calculant leurs véritables gains, propriétaires de petites entreprises comprenant coûts de compensation employé, professionnels fiscaux, conseillers financiers, et quiconque souhaitant comprendre sa situation fiscale complète et salaire après impôts.
seoContent.importantNotes: Ce calculateur fournit des estimations basées sur tranches d'impôt de 2024 et déductions standard. Les impôts réels peuvent varier selon revenu additionnel, déductions, crédits, et lois fiscales locales. Consultez un professionnel fiscal pour conseils fiscaux personnalisés. Les impôts FICA ont des limites de revenu pour Sécurité Sociale (€168.600 en 2024).
